Job Title: Head of Product

Location: Austin, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Please email applications to jobs@funga.earth with the subject line "Head of Product - [Your Name]". Please include a CV and a one-page cover letter describing your qualifications and interest in this position. Do not contact the hiring manager directly; only applications sent via email will be considered.
Applications will be open through May 3, 2024, with an anticipated start date by July 1, 2024.
Reports to: Chief Growth OfficerLocation: Austin, TX (preferred) or remote within continental United States
About FungaFunga is a public benefit corporation harnessing forest fungal networks to address the climate crisis. We combine modern DNA sequencing and machine learning technology with breakthrough research on the forest microbiome to put the right native, biodiverse communities of mycorrhizal fungi in the right place. This leads to more quality wood created more quickly, more carbon sequestered, and more resilient forests. We serve land partners seeking to implement regenerative forestry practices that improve productivity and sustainability, and corporate carbon buyers building high-quality carbon removal portfolios with strong social and biodiversity outcomes. We're a team of passionate scientists and builders on a mission to draw down at least three gigatons of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere by 2050.
If you are excited by starting new things, learning as you go, and being hands-on in applying your work to the private sector, you will dig working with us. We encourage you to apply even if only some of the below criteria are met - just make sure to tell us why you’re excited about Funga!
About the RoleYears of research and in-field trials have gone into developing this powerful technology for improving the health and performance of forestry projects, which are vital to addressing many of our current crises. We are in the middle of a climate crisis, and Funga can pull down tens-of-millions of tons of additional CO2e every year. We are in a global shortage of timber and building materials, and Funga can accelerate the delivery of board-feet in a way that improves managed forest ecologies, rather than destroys them. The current biodiversity crisis has roots underground where sub-soil ecologies have been destroyed and homogenized.
Funga aims to catalog and restore foundational soil biodiversity. Global businesses and governments need high-quality carbon removal solutions to enable emissions reduction and attainment of net zero goals. Funga is building a new class of sustainable, high-quality carbon removal with the potential to achieve enormous scale in the next five to ten years.
Delivering on this potential requires translating complex science and technology into meaningful business outcomes. We are looking for an experienced Head of Product with a track record of creating compelling and differentiated product narratives through design and execution.
This role will report to the Chief Growth Officer, and is a highly cross-functional role that requires close collaboration with company leadership as well as the Science, Operations and Marketing functions. The role will be responsible for developing the Product Management function at Funga in service of increasing our success within our existing carbon product and new product offerings. You will oversee new product innovations and optimize the efficiency and adoption rates of existing products. The role will involve navigating the complex and rapidly evolving voluntary carbon and forestry markets. While experience in natural climate solutions and forestry is desired, more important is your excitement to implement new approaches, problem solve, and think creatively.
What You Will DoEstablish the foundations for strategic product planning and management, ensuring a strong connection between Funga’s core technology and evolving customer needs.Define and align core teams around the product vision, strategy and roadmap.Create and present product innovations, strategic decision proposals, as well as the calculation of product business cases.Define, monitor and report on Funga’s relevant OKRs and control of the measures to achieve the objectives and key results set.Build and lead a cross functional product team in which you motivate and achieve steady improvements in your area.Help grow Funga into a global forestry solution for climate, forest restoration and regenerative forestry.
Our Ideal Candidate Will Have5-8 years of product experience including strategic design, testing, building, and operationalizing products for customers.3+ years of experience in forestry, nature-based climate solutions, or carbon markets preferred.Demonstrated experience in go-to-market planning, testing and execution.Effective communicator, skilled presenter & growth-minded interpersonal skills.Proven track record of strong influencing and stakeholder management skills.Strong track record of working collaboratively on cross-functional teams.Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple projects and initiatives.Strong interpersonal skills - this role will interact with customers as well as our internal science, operations, and business teams.Resourceful and self-motivated for this growth opportunity.Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, and collaborative climate.Excited to lay the groundwork to scale multiple products and management in a fast-paced environment.Previous people management and team development experience preferred.Previous startup experience preferred (i.e. Series C or earlier).Your unique strengths - if you don't match everything we're looking for, tell us why you'd be a great fit in your cover letter.
We expect you toBring a passion for ecology, biodiversity, and addressing climate change.Work collaboratively with our Austin, TX and remote team members to build shared understanding of products across all functions.Take ownership of all project work from end-to-end.Take part in strategic thinking.Communicate, develop, and document all work with painstaking detail.Travel up to 25% of the time to conferences, prospective customer meetings, and team offsite events.
Why Join Funga?Make a meaningful impact: Contribute to innovative solutions addressing one of the most pressing global challenges today - climate change.Collaborative environment: Work closely with a diverse team of scientists, foresters, and business leaders who share a common passion for sustainability.Career growth: Be part of a pioneering company with opportunities for professional development and leadership within product, forestry, and nature based solutions.Participate in comprehensive healthcare benefits and employee equity programs.
Salary and BenefitsThe expected salary range for this role is $120,000-160,000 USD, with actual salary based on qualifications and experience.
Funga offers a competitive benefits package including equity in our fast-growing startup; a flexible time off policy; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and a wellness reimbursement program. Our team is in a dynamic growth phase. By joining us at this stage, you can shape our benefits and culture, and participate in our business success!

Experience Level (if available): None
